title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 163.20 - Distance learning programs
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 163.20 - Distance learning programs

State Regulations
(a) Distance education
is defined as any educational process based
on the geographical separation of instructor and student (for example, CD-ROM, disk, on-line learning). Educational providers who wish to offer distance
learning programs must have their programs evaluated and approved in accordance
with the provisions of this Part. Each provision of this Part shall be
applicable to distance learning programs, unless specifically otherwise
directed or authorized by the Secretary of State. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19
ยง
163.20

Adopted

New

York State Register June 22, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 25, eff. 6/22/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
